reasoning:
First things first, I need to determine if I understand Google’s business well enough to invest. Internet search, online advertising and rapidly evolving technology simply lie outside my circle of competence. I’ve spent 60-plus years sticking to businesses I can see, touch or otherwise fully grasp – think Coke, See’s Candies, Apple’s consumer ecosystem or simple utilities and railroads.   

On the moat front, Google undoubtedly benefits from scale, network effects and strong brand recognition. But without reliable data on revenue trends, margins, R&D investment and competitive pressures, I can’t judge whether its advantages will hold for the next 20 years.   

Regarding management, I’ve long admired Larry Page and Sergey Brin’s vision and Sundar Pichai’s stewardship; Alphabet has generated healthy free cash flow and returned capital via buybacks. But I have no hard numbers here to assess capital allocation metrics or board alignment with shareholders.   

Financially, the absence of balance-sheet details, debt levels or consistent earnings data means I can’t confirm a ‘financial fortress’ – one of my key criteria.   

Intrinsic value? With no reliable estimates of future cash flows, discount rates or growth assumptions, any valuation would be a guess. And a guess on price versus value is something I try to avoid.   

Long term, the prospects for artificial intelligence, cloud computing and digital ads are intriguing, but rapid change and fierce competition (from the likes of Amazon, Microsoft and emerging AI upstarts) raise red flags for someone who prefers predictability.   

Compared to opportunities in my existing portfolio – a consumer‐staples giant like Coca-Cola, a stable insurer like GEICO or Apple’s sticky ecosystem – I’d rather sit on my hands than dive into Google without deeper understanding. 

In short, I’m going to pass. When I lack competence or data, the right answer for Berkshire is usually ‘no.’ There’s no penalty for being patient.

moat_analysis.details: Insufficient data for comprehensive moat analysis

pricing_power_analysis.details: Insufficient data for pricing power analysis

book_value_analysis.details: Insufficient data for book value analysis
